snippet: Walid al-Moallem, the Syrian foreign minister, said that the country’s enemies concocted the refugee crisis and that a dialogue on a political transition was still possible.
abstract: Syrian Foreign Min Walid al-Moallem tells the United Nations that violence racking the country is entirely fault of other nations supplying armed opposition and refugee crisis has been concocted by Syria's enemies; says dialogue on political transition is still possible.
lead_paragraph: Walid al-Moallem, the Syrian foreign minister, said that the country’s enemies concocted the refugee crisis and that a dialogue on a political transition was still possible.

headline.seo: At U.N., Syria Blames Foes for Conflict and Refugee Crisis
headline.main: Syria Claims Refugee Crisis Was Invented
headline.print_headline: Syria Claims Refugee Crisis Was Invented

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
